instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.PP3V0_G3H: What is PP3V0_G3H? PP3V0_G3H is a 3.0v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Hello, got this machine it had water liquid spil on the keyboard. The board looks superclean, only one liquid indicator is a little red on the edge of the board, looks like not much hit the board. Even around the liquid indicator that was red all looks clean. I checked voltage, it actually turns on I get 19.5v and then the Amps move up for about 15 seconds from 1.4Amps to 1.55 and then drops to 0v, 19.5v still showing. CPU also gets hot, tried to boot from external drive, light up 15 seconds and then turns off. Any ideas what could cause this? Tomorrow will start measuring all voltages but if anyone has an indication where to look, that would be appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Did you try the board alone, without anything else connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
Yes, and I also tried with keyboard, display and external SSD connected to see if it can boot but same thing happens, turns on, hot CPU, 19v going up to 1.55A then 19v with 0A, CPU hot

Edit: the display being an external display connected via HDMI, as the original one is just black and I dont have a new one at hand to try

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Try to confirm USB activity, if possible...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: OK I will try tomorrow and let you know, I have a LED on USB mouse but turns off as the Amps drop to 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
Here some more measurements:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.58
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.418
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> = 20.08
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> = 3.417
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.41
<SIGNAL>PP3V0_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.09
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.32
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.14
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = 3.3v drops to 0 when Amps drop on meter
<SIGNAL>PP5S_S4</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> comes up after it gets enable signal, and then drops to 0 with the rest.

SMC bypass didnt work (10 seconds holding powerbutton, keep holding 10 more while charger plugged in, correct me if thats wrong pls)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Since <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> did output 5V for a short time i think I can skip that circuit, also no shorts here. Maybe some short in a lower powerline stops it from turning on, will keep measuring my way down and report back if i find more

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: OK, seems I have shorts near CPU and GPU... :(. L8000, L7410/20 but also when i measure GPU LA640/650. I guess this is game over :)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: I measured CPU temp with my FLircam, it shoots up to 110 Celcius, and then shuts down. Hottest I have seen a mac is 105, 110 seems not good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
Does it reach 110 degrees in such short time?
That's no good, can only be bad CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Update, after i assembled the mac, i connected the charger one last time (battery disconnected), and fan started to spin, however this time no shutdown and it kept running. I measured voltages around CPU, actually the GPU gets 0.9 volts. CPU GPU was hot but CPU cold while fan was spinning. I get 0v on L7420, would there be a chance that the CPU powersupply failed? Or should i stop wasting my time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Yes when i connected the powercable without anything installed (so also no cooling plate) it ran upto 110 degree in 10 seconds. Now I reassembled it it keeps at 0.42 degree same as GPU, fan is spinning hapiilly, but no power to CPU. I did give it another ultrasonic before assembling, wouldnt be the first time some stuff came back to life after that....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
Some more measurements around CPU circuit:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> = 12.59 not shorted
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> to <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/20 = 5V no short
L7330 = 1.12v
L7211/21/31 =  1.09
L7410/L7420 = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
You getCPU VCORE, but no iGPU voltage.
I know some old boards don't have iGPU voltage under low graphics charge.
Could be similar thing here.
And if board starts with GPU, no need to power iGPU I think.

Check for USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
I do have USB activity, when the mac turns on it wont switch off. You can see attached image with voltage and amps + USB mouse attached. Also I attached a Flir image, CPU and GPU seem active although L7410/20 have 0 voltage, you can see they dont heat up. I was not able to upload images so here some links:

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1IUMAdaiCuY8wuq2Rd93kpudE7v_X65ZP[/url]
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1-Zi0uNMt_kNNB_nH-hid8A4744ywoWrP[/url]

Any hope for this board or should I call it a day?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Oh i got what you are saying, the integrated graphics is not working when dedicated is turned on, which it seems it is as it gets 0.9v, correct? So this here is not the issue i guess. I also tried to boot from external HDD and although the LED burns its not flickering as it usually does when it boots. It seems the Mac is not booting up, but running.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: Did some more checking it looks like i have all voltages, 1.2, 1.8, 1.0, 0.9 in S0 states

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message:
Maybe some liquid arrived to board.
And new boards are very sensitive; dead CPU maybe...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid on keyboard
threads.message: But it looks like it is running, cpu is 50 degrees and so is the gpu, and fan keeps spinning. Anyway to make sure of this?
